ygData.subject: Re: EQ Weddings held in public
ygData.msgSnippet: I too have attended a few weddings.  One was LOIO, one in TD on Ogre Island and one in Highpass.  They were all held far from people and standard train routes.
ygData.messageBody:
I too have attended a few weddings. One was LOIO, one in TD on Ogre
Island and one in Highpass. They were all held far from people and
standard train routes. They were all done in /Say so they didn't
take over the zone. There were a few shouts to warn off people from
the area before it started. And they were short!

Yeah, we all got drunk after every one! It was great hearing all the
gibberish. No deaths though. GM's made sure of that.

Tuldayen Grimblade
Pathfinder of Tunare
Terris-Thule, Summoners of the Realm
http://www.magelo.com/eq_view_profile.html?num=761750


--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Fire on High" <scendera@o...>
wrote:
> I've been to one there, one in POG, one in Gfay, and one in TwiSea
at the Elemental Island. Beautiful all, mind you, but OMG the lag in
TS! Even on the best of days that zone is brutal to my poor puter,
and with the whole guild there...
>
> The Gfay wedding had a reception in D'vinn's tower in CB,
incidentally, and we had a couple of deaths from drunken revellers
falling out the window...this was pre Luclin for sure, and possibly
pre Velious...
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Wulfric Rennison
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Saturday, November 29, 2003 12:47 PM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] EQ Weddings held in public
>
>
> First off, I agree with you. Weddings held in /shout or /ooc are
a bad idea. Plus it defeats the entire reason why channels were
made. Anybody who wants to attend the wedding should just join the
wedding channel. Stop spamming up the public chat with crap people
dont necessarily care about except who's involved. Also, the
waterfall in Thurg is a bad choice of places. Granted it's beautiful
to look at, but its a high traffic area. They should expect people
to constantly be running through there. Especially for the reason
you stated, training mobs to zone to escape. Everyone does it,
nobody's innocent, it's part of the game.
>
> Personally, I wouldn't think too much of it because there's
nothing they can really do to you to get revenge. And if they do
want revenge then they have serious issues cause it's JUST A GAME!
>
>
> Wulfric
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: sastvis
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Friday, November 28, 2003 9:00 PM
> Subject: [EverQuest] EQ Weddings held in public
>
>
> I was in GD today and was slicing through wurms with my trusty
> necromantic pet when 2 more wurms jumped me and i had to run.
The
> closest zone was thurgadin and i had to pray to cazic-thule
that the
> coldain didn't hate Iksar Necromancers.
> I had heard about a wedding being held earlier and i remembered
that
> it was at the waterfall by thurgadin so i shouted train to
thurgadin
> and remembered that i could FD so i did to make sure that i
wasn't
> killed and that the wurms did't spoil the wedding. Luckily i
was far
> enough from the wedding that the wurms ran back to their caves.
> Heres where it stars... First of all the wedding was in OOC.
Bad
> choice. Second the peeps of the wedding kept telling people in
the
> zone to "Shutup" or "Stfu" That was being rude. I proceeded
to tell
> them that they should hold a wedding in SAY or a seperate
channel.
> They all got pissed at me and everyone there kept vowing
revenge on
> me. Made me a bit mad but i held it in so that i didn't
purposefully
> give them a reason to get mad. They continued to nag on and on
so i
> allerted my guild and they all thought the same thing. A
Wedding
> should be held in private chat and if others talk in the zone
just
> filter the ooc and shouts. The wedding was very badly planned
and
> now i have a whole guild mad at me. ( the other guild that was
> having the marriage not mine) I was wondering what you all
think of
> weddings in EQ and was i justified in shouting train and
telling them
> that they should hold their wedding in private if they don't
want to
> hear all the shouts and ooc's of a zone.
>
> Piezie V'rix
> 47th Necromancer
> Fennin Ro
